item.title: 𝐄𝐧𝐡𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐆𝐥𝐨𝐛𝐚𝐥 𝐒𝐮𝐩𝐩𝐥𝐲 𝐂𝐡𝐚𝐢𝐧 𝐑𝐞𝐬𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐭𝐡𝐫𝐨𝐮𝐠𝐡 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐄𝐮𝐫𝐚𝐬𝐢𝐚𝐧 𝐌𝐢𝐝𝐝𝐥𝐞 𝐂𝐨𝐫𝐫𝐢𝐝𝐨𝐫
item.description: The current Red Sea crisis poses significant disruptions to global supply chain resilience. In response, the Middle Corridor, also known as the Trans-Caspian International Transport Route (TITR), is gaining momentum. This route integrates multimodal transport modes, including rail and sea, connecting Chinese and European markets via Central Asia and the South Caucasus. Figure 1: Tran-Caspian International Transport Route (TITR) (Source: https://www.azernews.az/business/223185.html) Amidst geopolitical conflicts, the Middle Corridor is undergoing a crucial period of development.
